context: Multi-agent systems gaining real traction. Claude Code shipping features weekly. OpenAI Operator in beta. The shift from single-model prompting to orchestrated agent fleets is accelerating.

items.author: @karpathy
items.content: The most underrated thing about agents is tool use reliability. We're at maybe 85% — need 99% for real autonomy.

items.author: r/artificial
items.content: Claude Code just shipped hooks and custom slash commands — this is the IDE killer nobody saw coming

items.author: AI Explained
items.content: Why Multi-Agent Systems Will Replace Single-Model Apps in 2026

items.author: The Verge
items.content: Anthropic's Claude agent SDK enables custom AI agent pipelines for enterprise workflows

items.author: Axiom
items.content: OpenClaw is positioned at the intersection of multi-agent orchestration and personal computing. The gateway model lets agents coordinate across devices — this is the future.
